keyMoments.title: Intense Battle Against Mr. 2 Bon Clay
keyMoments.description: Sanji engages in one of his most challenging fights, battling Mr. 2 Bon Clay in a spectacular display of leg-based martial arts.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Sanji's combat prowess relying purely on his physical abilities without Devil Fruit powers.

keyMoments.title: Multiple French Technique Debuts
keyMoments.description: Sanji unveils numerous new techniques named after French cuts of meat, including Joue Shoot, Basse Côte, Longe, Tendron, Flanchet, Quasi, Cuisseau, Jarret, Queue, and Veau Shot.
keyMoments.significance: Expands Sanji's combat repertoire and reinforces his culinary-themed fighting style.

keyMoments.title: Chivalry Exploited as Critical Weakness
keyMoments.description: When Mr. 2 transforms into Nami, Sanji becomes completely unable to attack, revealing his chivalrous code as both his defining trait and exploitable weakness.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the depth of Sanji's principles and foreshadows future challenges this weakness will create.

keyMoments.title: Spectacular Handstand Combat Sequence
keyMoments.description: Sanji performs an incredible fighting sequence entirely on his hands, exchanging rapid-fire kicks with Mr. 2 in constant motion.
keyMoments.significance: One of the most visually impressive displays of Sanji's physical prowess and fighting skill.

keyMoments.title: Discovers Mr. 2's Critical Weakness
keyMoments.description: Through tactical observation, Sanji realizes Mr. 2 must revert to his original form to execute proper Okama Kenpo techniques.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Sanji's combat intelligence and strategic thinking beyond just physical fighting.
keyMoments.quote: I see it now... you have to become yourself to use your ballet techniques!

keyMoments.title: Clever Psychological Deception
keyMoments.description: Sanji tricks Mr. 2 into touching his face by claiming there's something on it, forcing the transformation reversal.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Sanji's ability to use psychological warfare and quick thinking in combat.
keyMoments.quote: Hey, you've got something on your face.

keyMoments.title: Victory Over Mr. 2 Bon Clay
keyMoments.description: Sanji defeats Mr. 2 with his Veau Shot technique and retrieves Usopp's goggles, eliminating one of Baroque Works' strongest officers.
keyMoments.significance: Major victory contributing to the downfall of Baroque Works in Arabasta.

keyMoments.title: Shows Respect to Defeated Opponent
keyMoments.description: After victory, Sanji spares Mr. 2 and thanks him for the good fight, demonstrating honor and respect for a worthy adversary.
keyMoments.significance: Reveals Sanji's honorable nature and capacity for mercy even toward enemies.

abilities.description: A kick targeting the cheek area, named after the French word for cheek.
A kick named after the French term for rib cut.
A kick named after the French term for loin.
A kick named after the French term for breast meat.
A kick named after the French term for flank.
A kick named after the French term for rump.
A kick named after the French term for leg cut.
A kick named after the French term for shank.
A kick named after the French term for tail.
A powerful finishing kick named after veal, used to defeat Mr. 2 Bon Clay.

reveals.information: Sanji's chivalrous code prevents him from attacking anyone with a woman's appearance, even if it's an enemy transformation
Sanji demonstrates tactical intelligence by observing and exploiting Mr. 2's Devil Fruit limitation

name.japanese: ベンサム (Mr.2・ボン・クレー)

keyMoments.title: Okama Kenpo Arsenal Displayed
keyMoments.description: Mr. 2 demonstrates his full array of Ballet Kenpo techniques including Ballet Chop, Keri Pointe, Mascara Boomerang, Prima, Bombardier, Bombardier Arabesque, and Grand Fouetté.
keyMoments.significance: Showcases the unique and deadly nature of Mr. 2's fighting style combining ballet with martial arts.

keyMoments.title: Exploits Sanji's Weakness Through Transformation
keyMoments.description: Mr. 2 uses his Mane Mane no Mi powers to transform into Nami, completely paralyzing Sanji who cannot bring himself to attack a woman's form.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the psychological warfare potential of the Mane Mane no Mi and nearly secures victory through strategic use of powers.
keyMoments.quote: What's wrong, Sanji? Can't you hit a woman?

keyMoments.title: Epic Ballet Kenpo vs Leg Technique Clash
keyMoments.description: Engages in a spectacular rapid-fire exchange of kicks with Sanji, demonstrating mastery of leg-based combat.
keyMoments.significance: Creates one of the most memorable and well-choreographed fight scenes in the Arabasta Arc.

keyMoments.title: Devil Fruit Limitation Exposed
keyMoments.description: Sanji discovers that Mr. 2 cannot execute proper Okama Kenpo techniques while transformed, requiring him to revert to his original form for martial arts.
keyMoments.significance: Reveals a critical weakness in the Mane Mane no Mi's combat application that leads to Mr. 2's defeat.

keyMoments.title: Tricked into Transformation Reversal
keyMoments.description: Falls for Sanji's deception about something being on his face, instinctively touching his left cheek and reverting to original form.
keyMoments.significance: Shows how psychological tactics can overcome Devil Fruit powers.

keyMoments.title: Defeated by Sanji's Veau Shot
keyMoments.description: After being forced back into original form, Mr. 2 is defeated by Sanji's finishing technique, ending the battle.
keyMoments.significance: Eliminates one of Baroque Works' strongest officers from the Arabasta conflict.

keyMoments.title: Receives Respect from Victor
keyMoments.description: Despite defeat, Mr. 2 is spared and acknowledged by Sanji as a worthy opponent, setting the foundation for future mutual respect.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes the honorable relationship between Mr. 2 and the Straw Hats that will continue in future arcs.

abilities.description: A chopping attack incorporated into the Okama Kenpo style.
A variation of the Bombardier technique with arabesque positioning.
A spinning kick technique based on the ballet fouetté turn.

reveals.information: Cannot use Okama Kenpo techniques properly while transformed; must revert to original form for martial arts
Touching the left cheek reverses the Mane Mane no Mi transformation back to original form

keyMoments.title: Orders Palace Destruction
keyMoments.description: Vivi makes the painful decision to destroy the Alubarna Palace, convincing Chaka to load it with gunpowder as a signal to unite the warring armies.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Vivi's growth as a leader willing to sacrifice her kingdom's greatest symbol for peace.
keyMoments.quote: We have to blow up the palace to get everyone's attention!

keyMoments.title: Confronted by Crocodile at Palace
keyMoments.description: Just as Vivi prepares to execute her plan, Crocodile arrives at the palace with her kidnapped father, King Cobra.
keyMoments.significance: Creates a critical crisis that threatens both Vivi's plan and her father's life.

reveals.information: Willing to sacrifice the palace, the ultimate symbol of her kingdom, to save her people

keyMoments.title: Appears at Palace with King Cobra
keyMoments.description: Crocodile arrives at the Alubarna Palace at the critical moment, bringing the kidnapped King Cobra and interrupting Vivi's plan to destroy the palace.
keyMoments.significance: Escalates the conflict and puts Vivi in a dire situation with both her plan and father in jeopardy.

keyMoments.title: Supports Vivi's Palace Destruction Plan
keyMoments.description: After initial hesitation, Chaka agrees with Vivi's difficult decision and orders soldiers to load the palace with gunpowder.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Chaka's loyalty to Vivi and his understanding of the desperate situation requiring desperate measures.
